ETYMOLOGY: From Old French lever 'to raise', from Latin levare 'to lighten, raise'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To impose or collect (a tax, fee, or fine).
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The government decided to levy a new tax on luxury goods.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 政府决定对奢侈品征收新税。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: In times of war, the king would levy an army from his subjects.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 战争时期，国王会向臣民征募军队。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An act of levying a tax, fee, or fine, or the tax, fee, or fine itself.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 征税，征费；征收的税款或费用。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new environmental levy will be added to utility bills.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 新的环境税将被加到水电费账单中。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A body of troops that have been conscripted.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The country gathered a large levy to defend its borders.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该国召集了一支庞大的军队来保卫边境。
